question.title: Spring Boot ignores @XmlJavaTypeAdapter
question.body:
I have a date member with Annotation jakarta.xml.bind.annotation.adapters.XmlJavaTypeAdapter

@XmlJavaTypeAdapter(LocalDateTimeAdapter.class)
private LocalDateTime mydate;

When i send xml body to my service

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
...
<mydate>2025-10-15 09:49:54</mydate>
...

i got an error:

Resolved [org.springframework.http.converter.HttpMessageNotReadableException: JSON parse error: Cannot deserialize value of type `java.time.LocalDateTime` from String "2025-10-15 09:49:54"

This is because Spring Boot use Jackson and not my JaxB Adapter.

How can i configure Spring Boot to use my JaxB Adapter?

Here is my Adapter:

public class LocalDateTimeAdapter extends XmlAdapter<String, LocalDateTime> {

    private static final DateTimeFormatter STANDARD_DATETIME_PATTERN = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss");

    public LocalDateTime unmarshal(String value) {
        try {
            return LocalDateTime.parse(value, STANDARD_DATETIME_PATTERN);
        } catch (Exception e) {
            throw new MyException(e.getMessage(), e);
        }
    }

    public String marshal(LocalDateTime localDateTime) {
        try {
            return localDateTime.format(STANDARD_DATETIME_PATTERN);
        } catch (Exception e) {
            throw new MyException(e.getMessage(), e);
        }
    }
}

Do you have any ideas? Thanks a lot

EDIT: I found the reason but no solution. The “net.sf.jasperreports” library comes with jackson-dataformat-xml as a dependency, and SpringBoot picks the XML parser from jackson-xml instead of jaxb.
